sen.e: Tadamasa WADA (1615 - April 23, 1624) was a samurai of the early Edo period.

sen.j: 若くして池田忠雄の家老となり、寛永9年（1632年）の鳥取藩転封時には先に鳥取に向かい、土地の視察や屋敷地の確認などの諸事務を処理した。
sen.e: He was appointed chief retainer of Tadao IKEDA at a young age and he took care of various things related to relocating the Tottori Domain in 1632, including visiting Tottori ahead to inspect the land and residential area.

sen.j: 若くして優れた才能の持ち主であり、将来が有望視されていたが、寛永19年（1642年）3月、江戸に向かう途中に突然発病し、京都に於いて没した。
sen.e: Although he was regarded as a promising talented young man, he was suddenly attacked with a disease on his way to Edo and died in Kyoto in April 1642.

sen.e: Because he and his wife, a daughter of Sanehisa TOKUDAIJI, did not have biological children, they adopted the second son of Takanari ARAO, Tadanobu WADA, as their successor.
